text: Erigeron vicarius is an Asian species of flowering plants in the daisy family. It grows in alpine meadows in Xinjiang, Uzbekistan, and Kazakhstan. Erigeron vicarius is a perennial herb up to 28 cm (11 inches) tall, producing a short, branching rhizomes. Its flower heads have blue ray florets surrounding yellow disc florets.Flora of China, Erigeron vicarius Botschantzev, 1957. 蓝舌飞蓬 lan she fei peng ==References== vicarius Category:Flora of Asia Category:Plants described in 1957
title: Erigeron vicarius
